to satirize; to mock; to recite; Taiwan pr. [feng4]
высмеивать; издеваться; читать; Тайвань пр. [feng4]
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 諷)
Pictophonetic: 风 indicates the sound; 讠 (speech) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
讽刺 [ fěng cì ]: to satirize; to mock; irony; satire; sarcasm
嘲讽 [ cháo fěng ]: to sneer at; to ridicule; to taunt
讥讽 [ jī fěng ]: to satirize; to ridicule; to mock
冷嘲热讽 [ lěng cháo rè fěng ]: frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
讽喻 [ fěng yù ]: parable; allegory; satire

讽字的基本解释

讽
（諷）
fěng
不看着书本念，背书：讽诵（抑扬顿挫地诵读）。讽咏。
用含蓄的话劝告或讥刺：讽刺。讽谏（不直指其事，而用委婉曲折的言语进谏）。讽喻（一种修辞手法，用说故事等方式说明事物的道理）。讽一劝百。

讽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fěng］
［《廣韻》方鳳切，去送，非。］
“讽1”的繁体字。“風3”的被通假字。
(1)背诵。
(2)泛指诵读，诵念。
(3)用委婉的语言暗示、劝告或讥刺、指责。

讽字的英文翻译

◎ 讽
mock

讽字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　諷； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1188第18
【唐韻】芬鳳切【集韻】【韻會】方鳳切，?風去聲。【說文】誦也。【周禮·春官·大司樂】以樂語敎國子，興道諷誦言語。【註】倍文曰諷，以聲節之曰誦。【前漢·藝文志】太史試，學童能諷書九千字以上，乃得爲史。【晉書·阮瞻傳】諷誦遺言，不若親承音旨。　又【廣雅】敎也。【玉篇】譬喩也。【集韻】諫刺也。【增韻】託音曰諷。【史記·滑稽傳】優孟常以談笑諷諫。【家語】忠臣之諫君有五義焉，吾從其諷諫乎。【白虎通】諷者，智也。患禍之萌流，睹其事未彰而諷告，此智性也。又與風通。【詩·國風·關雎序】風，風也。【註】上如字，下卽諷字。崔靈恩云：用風感物，則謂之諷。又【小雅】或出入風議。【箋】風猶放也。卽諷議。【前漢·嚴助傳】令助諭意，風指於南越。【師古註】以天子之意指諷告也。　又【廣韻】方馮切，音風。亦誦也。一曰告也。

讽字的源字形

讽字的起名意思

本义指背诵，朗读，传诵。后引申为用含蓄的话词劝告或讥刺。

Satire
Basic explanation of words
Satire
(Sarcasm)
fěng
Read without looking at the book, endorse the book: satirical recitation (recite with circumflex and frustration). Satire.
Use implicit words to advise or ridicule: sarcasm. Satire (do not refer directly to the matter, but use euphemistic and tortuous language to enter). Allegory (a rhetorical device that uses stories to explain the truth of things). Ironically persuade a hundred.

The wind goes away. 【Said Wen】Recite also. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Da Si Le】Teach the son of the country with music, and chant the words of Taoist satire. [Note] Beiwen is said to be satire, and it is recited as syllable. [Pre-Han·Yiwenzhi] Taishi Exam, if students can satirize books with more than 9,000 words, it is for history. [Jin Shu·Ruan Zhan Biography] The satirical chanting of the last words is not as good as a personal inheritance.　[Guang Ya] again. [Jade articles] For example, also. [Ji Yun] Admonishment also. [Add rhyme] Suoyin said satire. [Historical Records·Comical Biography] You Meng often talks and laughs and satirizes. [Family language] The admonishment of the loyal minister has five righteousnesses, and I am almost ironic from it. [Baihutong] Satire, Zhiya. The sprouting stream of misfortune, irony after seeing the matter is not revealed, this is also wise. It is also connected with the wind. 【Poetry·National Style·Guanju Preface】Wind, wind also. [Note] The above is like the word, and the next is a satire. Cui Lingenyun: It is ironic to use the wind to feel things. Also [Xiaoya] or go in and out of the wind. [J] The wind is still letting go. Satire
Source glyph
Satire
Name meaning
The original meaning refers to recitation, reading aloud, and reciting. The latter extension is to use implicit words to advise or ridicule.
形声字。言(i)表意,言有说义,其形像张口发声,表示通读;風(风eng )表声,风流畅而有声,表示诵读应声音清晰
而流畅。諷简化为讽。本义是背诵,朗读。
